children.name: apply
children.definition: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do sth: xin, yêu cầu
examples: ‘I still haven’t received my passport.’ ‘When did you apply?’
apply to
I applied to four universities and was accepted by all of them.
apply for
She applied for a job with the local newspaper.
How many jobs had you applied for before you were offered this one?
We need toapply forplanningpermissionto build a garage.
apply to do sth
Finland did not apply to join the EC until 1992.
applicant[C] sb who officially asks for something such as a job, official document etc by writing or answering the questions on a form
Ten women were selected from over 30 applicants.
applicant for
Applicants for teacher-training courses need to have at least one year’s experience.
job/grant etc applicant
Many job applicants do not know how to write an appealing cover letter.

children.name: claim
children.definition: especially UK to ask for something, especiallymoney, froma government, company etc,because you believe you have a legal right to have it: đòi hỏi ,yêu cầu
examples: Thousands of people who should get welfare payments never even bother to claim them.
claim sth from sbđòi hỏi cái gì từ ai đó
The two companies are claiming $500 million each in damages from the government.
claim benefit/an allowance/damages etc
claim damages/compensationđòi hỏi thiệt hại, bồi thường
Because the accident had not been her fault, Barbara was able to claim damages.
If you’re still not satisfied, you may be able to claim compensation .
claim sth back
He should be able to claim the price of the ticket back.
claim onBritish English:
You can claim on the insurance if you have an accident while on holiday.

children.name: claimant[
examples: C] someone who asks for something, especially money, from the government, a court etc, because they believe they have a legal right to it:
The company will settle the lawsuit and provide compensation for claimants.
Garcia is representing three Spanish-speaking claimants in their case against the state.

children.name: request
children.definition: toofficiallyask sb for sth or ask sb to do sth: yêu cầu
examples: formalto ask for something in a polite or formal way :
To request more information, please call our toll free number.
You have to request permission if you want to take any photographs.

children.name: request that
examples: The prosecution has requested that all charges against Hodgkins are dropped.

children.name: request somebody to do something
examples: All club members are requested to attend the annual meeting.

children.name: be requested to do sth
examples: Anna was requested to make the necessary arrangements for the convention.

children.name: request something from somebody
examples: The Police Committee requested a grant from the Government to cover the extra expense.

children.name: approach
children.definition: to officially ask sb that you do not know well for sth or ask them to do sth, especially when you arenot sure if they will do it: đặt vấn đề, tiếp cận
examples: Will you be approaching the bank for a loan?
They had approached Barlow to see if he would participate in the charity event.
I have been approached regarding the possibility of selling the building to a startup company.

children.name: put in for
children.definition: to ask someone for something such as a job, government money etc that is available, by officially writing to them to say that you want it: viết đơn yêu cầu
examples: ▪ I’ve put in for a transfer to one of our overseas branches.
▪ All those who lost their jobs put in for compensation.
▪ Students must put in for grants at least six months before their course begins.

children.name: a statement, letter, message etc in which you ask for sth
request
children.definition: a statement, letter etc in which you ask for sth politely or formally:
examples: My grandfather’s last request was that there should be no flowers at his funeral.
request to do sth
Davis’s request to do research rather than teach this semester is being considered.
request for
They have made an urgent request for international aid.
request from
requests from customers for more information
request that
Anderson repeated his request that we postpone the meeting.
at sb’s request(= because someone asked for it to be done )
The study was done at the request of the Chairman.
on/upon requestwhen it is requested
Information about our testing procedure is available on request.
Further details will be sent on request.
by request
There were no flowers at the funeral, by request.
at sb’s requestbecause sb makes a request
Cummings eventually resigned at the governor’s request.

children.name: make a request
examples: I’d like to make a request.

children.name: submit/put in a request
children.definition: make a formal request
examples: The request was first submitted a number of months ago.|He has put in a request for two weeks' holiday.

children.name: agree to a request
children.definition: alsogrant sb’s requestformal
examples: The judge granted his request.|Diana was happy to agree to his request.

children.name: refuse/reject a request
children.definition: alsoturn down sb’s request
examples: He rejected their request for a meeting.|This request was turned down because of the cost.

children.name: receive a request
examples: They had received two urgent requests for assistance.

children.name: consider a request
examples: After carefully considering this request, the council rejected it.

children.name: respond to a request
examples: Thank you to those who responded to our request for information last month.

children.name: ignore a request
examples: They ignored repeated requests to leave the property.

children.name: a formal request
examples: The government made a formal request for food aid.

children.name: a special request
examples: Do you have any special requests?

children.name: an urgent request
examples: The family made an urgent request on television for help in finding their daughter.

children.name: a reasonable request
examples: It seemed like a reasonable request.

children.name: a strange/unusual request
examples: This is rather an unusual request.

children.name: a written request
examples: If you wish to take you child on holiday during the school term, you must make a formal written request.

children.name: repeated requests
examples: The bank would not reveal its figures, despite repeated requests.

children.name: demand
children.definition: a strong request saying very clearly what you want, especially when you are asking for sththat sb does not want to give you: yêu cầu, đề nghị
examples: ▪ A list of the students’ demands was presented to the dean of the law school.

children.name: demand for
examples: ▪ The union’s demand for an 8% across-the-board increase is still under consideration.

children.name: demand that
examples: ▪ A demand from your boss that you babysit his children is clearly unreasonable.

children.name: demand to do sth
examples: ▪ The government has refused the rebels’ demand to release their leader from prison.

children.name: make a demand
examples: ▪ The kidnappers made several demands in their telephone call to police.

children.name: claim
children.definition: a request for something, especiallymoney, that sb thinks they have a legal right to have: yêu cầu, đòi
examples: pay/wage claim(= a request from workers for more money )
Fill in and return theclaim formas soon as it arrives.
claim for
claims for compensation
The local people’s claims for compensation from the chemical factory have so far been ignored.
make/put in/file a claim
All claims should be made in writing.
After the fire we made a claim to our insurance company.
reject/uphold/lose etc a claim
He lost his claim for unfair dismissal.

children.name: petition
children.definition: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something: đơn thỉnh cầu, kiến nghị
examples: A petition signed by 1000 hospital doctors will be handed to the Minister of Health at lunchtime today.
Local groups have collected 17,000 votes on a petition to recall the mayor.
petition for/against
a petition against the new road
a petition opposing something458 local people signed a petition opposing the move.

children.name: sign a petition
examples: Five hundred villagers have signed the petition.

children.name: draw up a petition
children.definition: prepare one
examples: They are drawing up a petition which will be presented to the Archbishop.

children.name: organize a petition
examples: Local residents organized a petition against the closure of the library.

children.name: present/deliver a petition
examples: A group of pensioners went to London to present the petition.

children.name: a petition calling for something/demanding something
examples: A petition calling for an inquiry was signed by 15,118 people.

children.name: a petition driveAmerican English
children.definition: an attempt to get a lot of people to sign a petition
examples: More than 20,000 signatures were gathered by the petition drive.

children.name: application
children.definition: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something
examples: application for
an application for a grant
application from
The university welcomes applications from overseas students.

children.name: a job application
examples: He's made twenty-three job applications and had five interviews.

children.name: a planning application
children.definition: an official request for permission to build something
examples: We have lodged a planning application for a housing development on the site.

children.name: a formal application
children.definition: made officially
examples: Turkey has made a formal application to join the European Union.

children.name: an application form
examples: Simply fill in the application form and return it to your bank.

children.name: a letter of application
examples: The purpose of your letter of application is to get an interview.

children.name: make an application
examples: Candidates are advised to make an early application to the university.

children.name: fill out/fill in an application
children.definition: write all the necessary information on it
examples: I would like to fill out an application for the position.|You can fill in the application form online.

children.name: put in/submit an application
examples: The company has submitted a planning application.

children.name: consider an application
children.definition: think carefully about it before making a decision
examples: All applications will be considered on their own merits.

children.name: grant/approve an application
children.definition: give permission to do or have something
examples: What are the reasons for not granting this application?

children.name: refuse/reject/turn down an application
children.definition: say no to an application
examples: Their planning application was rejected because of a lack of parking facilities.

children.name: process an application
children.definition: officially deal with it
examples: Your application for British citizenship will be processed by the Immigration Service.

children.name: accept an application
examples: The college refused to accept my application.

children.name: withdraw your application
examples: The company withdrew its application to build the bridge.

children.name: appeal
children.definition: an urgent request for sth important such as freedom, money etc, especially in order to help sb in a bad situation: lời kêu gọi, yêu cầu khẩn khoản
examples: Dozens of relief agencies have responded to the drought-stricken country’s appeal.
appeal for
The police have issued a new appeal for information.
appeal to
All the organizations involved have sent urgent appeals to the government, asking for extra funding.
The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
appeal to sb to do sth
an appeal to the army to not use too much force

children.name: make/issue/launch an appeal
examples: Detectives are making an urgent appeal for information.|The hospital has launched an appeal to raise money for new equipment.

children.name: renew an appeal
children.definition: make an appeal again
examples: Detectives renewed their appeal for help from the public.

children.name: an urgent appeal
examples: The fire service has made an urgent appeal for more part-time firefighters.

children.name: a desperate appeal
examples: The family made a desperate appeal to their daughter to come home.|The London-based relief agency issued a desperate appeal for aid.

children.name: a direct appeal
examples: The police have issued a direct appeal to the witness to come forward with information.

children.name: a personal appeal
examples: Muslim leaders made a personal appeal for the hostage's freedom.

children.name: a public appeal
examples: She made a public appeal for the return of the ring.

children.name: a fresh appeal
children.definition: one that you make again
examples: The growing instability in the country has led to fresh appeals for calm.

children.name: a nationwide appeal
examples: The missing 15-year-old was found yesterday after a nationwide appeal for help.

children.name: an international appeal
examples: The organization has now launched an international appeal for volunteers.

children.name: a television appeal
examples: Following a national television appeal, several callers have phoned the police with information.

children.name: approach
children.definition: especially British an official request for someone that you do not know well to do something, especially when you are not sure if they will do it: đặt vấn đề

children.name: approach from
examples: ▪ The footballer said he’d received an approach from another team, and that he was considering the offer.

children.name: make an approach
examples: ▪ An official approach has been made but the hostages are unlikely to be released.

children.name: plea
children.definition: a strong emotional request for sb to help you or be kind to you: lời cầu xin. lời cầu khẩn
examples: Ignoring the man’s pleas, the soldier shot him in the head.
plea for
A homeless mother of six made a tearful plea for a home for her family.
a plea for help
plea to
The parents made an emotional plea to their child’s kidnappers.
make a plea
He made a plea for help/mercy.
Caldwell made a plea for donations.
